channel.title: [Requested]Adding Models, Items, NPCs, & Objects[/Requested]
channel.description:
[size=35pt]Adding Items[/size] Difficulty: 2/10 Purpose: Adding recolored items to a client Assumed knowledge: Java Classes modified: Class8.java --- Search in class8.java for: [code] class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);[/code] Under that add: [code] if(i == Item ID) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = ; //color class8.anIntArray160[0] = ; //color class8.anIntArray156[1] = ; //color class8.anIntArray160[1] = ; //color class8.anInt174 = ; //color class8.anInt181 = ; //color class8.anInt190 = ; //color class8.anInt198 = ; //color class8.anInt204 = ; //color class8.anInt169 = ; //color class8.anInt194 = ; //color class8.anInt165 = ; //color class8.anInt188 = ; //color class8.anInt200 = ; //color class8.anInt164 = ; //color class8.anInt175 = ; //color class8.anInt197 = ; //color class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Item Name"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Examine Info.".getBytes(); }[/code] Edit the [code] //color[/code] Codes to your liking. There are many tutorials on this if you need additional help.
[size=35pt]Adding Models[/size] Difficulty: 3/10 Purpose: Adding Models/custom items to a client Assumed knowledge: Java Classes modified: Class8.java, Models folder --- There are 3 types of models that [i]i[/i] know of...examples can be downloaded [url=http://uppit.com/AZAWAQW]here[/url].
I am not the best person to be making a tut about this, but I'll see what i can do. A simple example is Rune-Arc's Crystal longbow. (Model can be downloaded [url=http://uppit.com/8RE3VU]here[/url].) After adding the model to the "models" folder, open class8 and under [code]class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);[/code], add this: [code] if(i == ####) //Item ID { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = 11700; //Pretty sure this is model ID# in models folder class8.anInt181 = 1200; class8.anInt190 = 212; class8.anInt198 = 1983; class8.anInt169 = 40; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 11700; //Maybe same as above class8.anInt200 = 11700; //Maybe same as above class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Crystal Longbow"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A Crystal Longbow.".getBytes(); }[/code] The above is almost [i]always[/i] the format for adding models, i dont know, please do not ask me about this ask someone more experienced like Galkon. Also, when downloading models, be sure to ask the provider to give you this code, unless you want to figure it out yourself.
[size=35pt]Adding NPC[/size] Difficulty: 2/10 Purpose: Adding NPCs to client. Assumed knowledge: Java Classes modified: Class5.java, Models folder? --- Again, i am not the model master. I am not sure exactly how to do this.
You should first download any models required for this.
Anyway, open class5.java and add this under [code] class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60);[/code]: [code] if(i == ####) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Collect original NPC data class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.anIntArray94 = new int[2]; // Number of models the NPC uses int changedColors = 1; // Number of model colors changed on the NPC class5.anIntArray76 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray70 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray76[0] = 61; // Original model color class5.anIntArray70[0] = 926; // Changed model color class5.anIntArray94[0] = 10490; // 27789 //Pretty sure thats the model ID class5.anIntArray94[1] = 10491; // 27785 //Pretty sure thats the 2nd model ID class5.aString65 = "General Graardor"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = 624; //combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "The mighty lord Bandos!".getBytes(); // NPC description } [/code] That pretty much explains it as well as i can.
[size=35pt]Adding Objects[/size] Difficulty: 2/10 Purpose: Adding Objects to a client Assumed knowledge: Java Classes modified: Class46.java --- DOWNLOAD ALL MODELS NEEDED FOR ADDING OBJECTS! I am not quite sure the ints and the code to put in, Try asking the model provider for assistance with adding objects.

item.title: [Requested]Adding Models, Items, NPCs, & Objects[/Requested]
item.dc:creator: @Priest Priest
item.description:
@Priest wrote:

[size=35pt]Adding Items[/size]
Difficulty: 2/10
Purpose: Adding recolored items to a client
Assumed knowledge: Java
Classes modified: Class8.java

Search in class8.java for:

        class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);

Under that add:

if(i == Item ID) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = ; //color class8.anIntArray160[0] = ; //color class8.anIntArray156[1] = ; //color class8.anIntArray160[1] = ; //color class8.anInt174 = ; //color class8.anInt181 = ; //color class8.anInt190 = ; //color class8.anInt198 = ; //color class8.anInt204 = ; //color class8.anInt169 = ; //color class8.anInt194 = ; //color class8.anInt165 = ; //color class8.anInt188 = ; //color class8.anInt200 = ; //color class8.anInt164 = ; //color class8.anInt175 = ; //color class8.anInt197 = ; //color class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Item Name"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Examine Info.".getBytes(); }
Edit the //color Codes to your liking. There are many tutorials on this if you need additional help.

[size=35pt]Adding Models[/size]
Difficulty: 3/10
Purpose: Adding Models/custom items to a client
Assumed knowledge: Java
Classes modified: Class8.java, Models folder

There are 3 types of models that i know of…examples can be downloaded here.

I am not the best person to be making a tut about this, but I’ll see what i can do.
A simple example is Rune-Arc’s Crystal longbow. (Model can be downloaded here.)
After adding the model to the “models” folder, open class8 and under

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);, add this:

if(i == ####) //Item ID { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = 11700; //Pretty sure this is model ID# in models folder class8.anInt181 = 1200; class8.anInt190 = 212; class8.anInt198 = 1983; class8.anInt169 = 40; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 11700; //Maybe same as above class8.anInt200 = 11700; //Maybe same as above class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Crystal Longbow"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A Crystal Longbow.".getBytes(); }
The above is almost always the format for adding models, i dont know, please do not ask me about this ask someone more experienced like Galkon. Also, when downloading models, be sure to ask the provider to give you this code, unless you want to figure it out yourself.

[size=35pt]Adding NPC[/size]
Difficulty: 2/10
Purpose: Adding NPCs to client.
Assumed knowledge: Java
Classes modified: Class5.java, Models folder?

Again, i am not the model master. I am not sure exactly how to do this.

You should first download any models required for this.

Anyway, open class5.java and add this under

class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60);:

if(i == ####) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Collect original NPC data
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack";
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[2]; // Number of models the NPC uses
    int changedColors = 1; // Number of model colors changed on the NPC
    class5.anIntArray76 = new int[changedColors];
    class5.anIntArray70 = new int[changedColors];
    class5.anIntArray76[0] = 61; // Original model color
    class5.anIntArray70[0] = 926; // Changed model color
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = 10490; // 27789 //Pretty sure thats the model ID
         class5.anIntArray94[1] = 10491; // 27785 //Pretty sure thats the 2nd model ID
    class5.aString65 = "General Graardor"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = 624; //combat level
    class5.aByteArray89 = "The mighty lord Bandos!".getBytes(); // NPC description
}

That pretty much explains it as well as i can.

[size=35pt]Adding Objects[/size]
Difficulty: 2/10
Purpose: Adding Objects to a client
Assumed knowledge: Java
Classes modified: Class46.java

DOWNLOAD ALL MODELS NEEDED FOR ADDING OBJECTS!
I am not quite sure the ints and the code to put in, Try asking the model provider for assistance with adding objects.

Read full topic
